intro: Serapias somaliensis, commonly known as the Somali orchid, is a rare and endemic flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the genus Serapias, which is part of the orchid family, Orchidaceae. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically feature bright yellow or orange petals with intricate patterns. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky substrates or in open grasslands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Serapias somaliensis is considered a vulnerable species.
